intro: Dalea rubrolutea, commonly known as the scarlet and yellow milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive red and yellow floral patterns. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, compound leaves and showy blooms make it a notable species in its native habitat. Dalea rubrolutea is also valued for its ecological role in nitrogen fixation and as a food source for native pollinators.
